item.title: 50 BAU vet students set for overseas internships
item.description: 50 students from the 59th batch of the Faculty of Veterinary Science at Bangladesh Agricultural University (BAU) will undertake internships in six countries this year. The announcement came during the inauguration of the faculty’s internship program on Friday at the Syed Nazrul Islam Auditori

item.title: BNP categorically against proportional representation: AZM Zahid Hossain
item.description: Dr AZM Zahid Hossain, a member of BNP’s Standing Committee, has said that the party does not support elections under the proportional representation (PR) system under any circumstances. Speaking to journalists on Friday evening while attending a memorial event for late Anisur Rahman Laku at

item.title: Govt committed to free, fair and neutral Feb election: Home Adviser
item.description: Home Affairs Adviser Lieutenant General (Retd) Jahangir Alam Chowdhury has said the government is determined to ensure that the upcoming February elections are free, fair, and neutral. He made the remarks on Friday afternoon while attending the Kethin Chibardan festival at Bodhigyan Bhavana (Buddh

item.title: Head-on collision between bus and truck in Narail injures 15
item.description: At least 15 people, including women and children, were injured when a passenger bus collided head-on with a truck in Narail Sadar upazila on Friday afternoon. The accident occurred in front of Tularampur Highway Police Station on the Narail–Jashore highway. After the collision, the bus veere

item.title: Need for keeping workplaces politically neutral
item.description: To strengthen administrative and economic frameworks and advance sustainable development, government and private sector employees must remain free from political influence and see that they are not exploited as instruments of those in power. item.title: Integrating Ayurveda into health discourse in Bangladesh
item.description: In Bangladesh, the ancient tradition of Ayurveda is a deep-seated, holistic healing practice. However, it remains a peripheral part of the modern healthcare system. This failure to integrate into the mainstream represents a missed opportunity for a more inclusive and comprehensive health model, ste

item.title: Booming business of coaching centres
item.description: Private tuition or coaching has been an essential part of the country's mainstream primary and secondary education for a long time. item.title: What's ailing India-Bangladesh relations?
item.description: During his visit to New York for the UN General Assembly at the beginning of this month, Chief Adviser Professor Mohammad Yunus voiced a sentiment that revealed his government's growing frustration with India. item.title: Taking a balanced approach to trade liberalsation, AI
item.description: Despite risks of slowdown in global growth due to AI-related labour disruptions, and other issues, South Asia is still the world's fastest growing region.
